resources.string: Arvo already, eh, <PlayerName>?
<yes>Alright, nice chatting.
<haha>Today went fast!
<no>It’s already the bloody arvo!
<wave>I’m sure we’ll see each other soon enough.
Afternoon, <PlayerName>.
What do I owe you for the pleasure?
<haha>Well, I ain’t paying you for that short chat!
Hey <PlayerName>!
You ready to get flogged at this <bugComp>?
I'm coming 1st, I tell ya!
<thinking>This cold weather reminds me of back home…
Oh, you wanted to chat?
<thinking>I wonder how my brother is going...
Oh, G’day <PlayerName>.
It’s a bit nippy out today!
Try and stay warm!
<proud>Maybe visit some shops, eh?
It’s pretty cold today!
What can I do for you, <PlayerName>?
<haha>Alright then, see you!
<shy>Oh, <PlayerName>, this is really nice.
<no>I don’t think I’ve gotten a birthday gift that I didn’t have to trade for.
<glee>Thank you very much, you’ve made my day!
<glee>You beauty!
<yes>You always pull through for me, <PlayerName>.
<shy>Why don't I give you this in exchange for helping me out?
Sure, you can buy seeds from <NPCName>, but then they gotta grow.
Who has time for that?
<haha>You can just buy your food from me!
You can always get more <Dinks>, but you can never get more time!
<NPCName>’s inventions can be fun to use.
<no>A bit pricey for my tastes though…
<no>Personally? Nothing beats getting stuff done with your own two hands.
The sweat of your brow, a bit of elbow grease...
<haha>And a reasonably priced pickaxe is all you need!
You should definitely talk to <NPCName>.
<yes>He’s an interesting character.
<no>But between you and me? You just don’t need furniture!
<haha>Your place looks great already! Save your <Dinks>, I reckon.
Use them on something really important.
Maybe a <itemName>!
I have no idea how <NPCName> makes her clothes last so long.
<haha>They never break!
<thinking>That must really hurt her bottom line...
<no>You can’t get anything past <NPCName>, that’s for sure.
<shy>Oh, don’t worry, all my licenses are up to date… now.
Listen, <NPCName> is a great guy….
<thinking>But be careful about spending too many dinks on animals \n.
<no>They’re not gonna get you out of a tough situation \n.
<haha>And they’re certainly not going to help you smelt ore like my goods can!
You can donate your bugs and fish to <NPCName> if you want.
<pumped>But remember, I’ll give you a better price for them.
<haha>Best prices in town!
<NPCName> sure knows his dinks, I’ll give him that.
<yes>No messing around with that bloke.
How’s it going, <PlayerName>!
Nice to see you!
Catch you later, <PlayerName>.
It’s so good to see you, <PlayerName>!
Need anything?
<yes>Righto. Hope I see you later then!
Well if it isn’t <PlayerName>!
I knew I would see you today!
See you around, <PlayerName>.
Hey, it’s <PlayerName>, my favourite customer!
What can I get you, mate?
See you later, <PlayerName>!
Ah, <PlayerName>!
<yes>Always nice to see a friendly face.
Hope we can catch up soon, <PlayerName>.
Oh, it’s <PlayerName>. \nComing to see me?
<haha>But I’m not even open!
Hope we chat again, okay?
The heat is charging me up today!
<haha>And I love to charge!
Hooroo!
<shy>Phew!
<haha>It’s nearly as hot as my low, low prices!
You wanted to chat <PlayerName>?
Okay then, see you later, <PlayerName>.
<haha>Hot days like this make me glad I’m inside most of the time!
How are you handling the heat, <PlayerName>?
See you soon!
<NPCName> told me you’re the one to thank for getting this place all set up for me.
Thanks for that!
<yes>I have a feeling we will be doing a lot of business together.
Take a look at my wares and feel free to ask me about anything you are interested in.
<yes>Now, I make most of my <Dinks> selling exotic items back to <SouthCity>.
<haha>I guess you could say “exotic” means any of the items found here on <IslandName>.
<pumped>So, if you find anything, and I do mean anything, you don’t want, please drop by and show me.
<haha>I’ll offer you a great price for it!
<NPCName> says she has a surprise for us when the sun goes down…
<haha>I hope it’s heaps of <PermitPoints>.
<shy>I need to apply for some licences for next year.
G’day, <PlayerName>.
Or I guess I should say Happy <IslandDay>!
<NPCName> is cooking up some <Snags>.
<haha>I hope she doesn’t snag mine for herself!
What a night.
I reckon my brother would love this!
<haha>Love to charge people to see it at least!
I do miss him, but I know he can’t make it to <IslandName>...
G’day, <PlayerName>.
The <Snags> are ready!
Who would have guessed <NPCName> was such a good cook?
She should really open a <Snag> shop…
are you okay
im okay
not too great
Welcome to John's Goods! How can I help?
Sell goods.
I wanted to chat.
I'm good.
All right, show us what you got.
No worries, mate.
Thanks for stopping by.
G’day <PlayerName>.
How can I help?
Hooroo, mate!
Oh, G'day!
How’s it going, mate?
Righto, hooroo.
Hello there, <PlayerName>.
Do you need something?
<shy>See you later I guess!
Mate, how’s it going?
What's up?
Catch ya around, <PlayerName>.
<PlayerName>!
How are you going today?
Righto, hooroo.
<yes>Good to see you, <PlayerName>.
<haha>What do I owe you for the pleasure?
<haha>I’ll put my <Dinks> back in my pocket then!
Ah, early morning.
And you’re up as usual, <PlayerName>!
<glee>Enjoy your morning, mate!
The early <animalName> gets the <Dink>!
Is that why you're up, <PlayerName>?
Make something of your day okay, <PlayerName>!
Morning, <PlayerName>!
<yes>See you around.
I’ve had a big day!
It’s a good night to just relax!
Good night, <PlayerName>.
Finally the night is here.
<haha>Night time is <myName> time.
<haha>Welp, back to <myName> time I guess!
Oh, it’s <PlayerName>!
What are you doing out so late?
<wave>Have a good night!
Welcome to John's Goods!
<haha>Oh, wait, I’m not at work!
I’ll let you get back to it, <PlayerName>.
<no>Another day another <Dink>.
Enjoying your day, <PlayerName>?
<yes>Back to the <Dink> grind for me tomorrow.
<yes>Days like this are best, <PlayerName>.
<haha>Days where I get to go outside that is!
<sigh>Alright, mate.
Have a good day, okay?
Oh, you've changed your mind? Please come visit if you have anything you want to sell.
Thanks for visiting John's Goods.
Hmmm, I should start selling umbrellas…
Oh! Hi <PlayerName>!
Stay dry, <PlayerName>!
<no>It’s bloody bucking down today.
How are you,<PlayerName>?
Don't catch a cold, <PlayerName>!
You reckon this rain will let up?
<haha>I hope it doesn't!
I get all my tools from back in <SouthCity>.
<shy>I know they aren’t great quality and they break easily..
<haha>But, they’re the best tools you can get on <IslandName>.
<proud>I've been doing some stocktake recently and everything is looking real good.
<haha>Better than good, it’s John’s Goods!
Are you wondering why I can buy bugs off you at such a high price?
Those things make great pets back in <SouthCity>.
<haha>And people are willing to pay a fortune for a pet that won't take up half their house!
The fish from this island are an incredible treat for those people back in <SouthCity>.
<haha>I mean, the only thing you can catch in <SouthCity> are <Blobfish>!
<haha>So eating anything else is always a treat!
<thinking>I’ve been trying to get rid of some excess stock recently.
<haha>The thing is, I already have the best deals in town, so I haven’t adjusted the prices.
<yes>Everything has a value to someone, you know. You just have to find the right people and the right price.
<haha>Luckily, the people in <SouthCity> don’t know how common things certain things are over here, so I can charge them a bit more!
You look a little down today, <PlayerName>. \n..
Have you considered buying something?
<yes>That always makes me feel better.
<haha>You, buying something, I mean.
I wouldn’t trade trading for anything.
<thinking>I mean…
<haha>Unless it was a really good deal!
The secret to trading is to buy low, and sell high.
<thinking>...
<sigh>I probably should’ve sold you that information…
I worked hard to get the <PermitPoints> I needed to get my <CommerceLicence>.
<haha>My brother back in <SouthCity> worked really hard to get me to give him some of my <PermitPoints> so he could get his too!
<sigh>I’ve got to make enough <Dinks> this month or my brother will be in trouble back in <SouthCity>.
<no>I won't raise prices or anything like that...
<haha>Just be sure to keep selling me stuff, okay, <PlayerName>?
Sometimes I don’t know when to stop, you know?
<haha>I’ve shipped so many bugs this season I can’t even keep track of them!
<PlayerName>, you and I make a great team. You run around, collecting rare and valuable things, I buy them from you.
<proud>For a very, vary fair price I might add.
Then I sell them onto my buyer in <SouthCity>.
<haha>This way, everyone gets <Dinks>!
It’s become very obvious that you are my favourite customer, <PlayerName>.
I would offer you a discount, but my brother is actually in a bit of debt at the moment, and he really needs the <Dinks>!
<haha>But just remember that I was thinking of it, okay?
<yes>The people in <SouthCity> are happy to eat anything that isn’t <BlobFish>.
<yes>So when they get to buy the exotic fish that can be found here on <IslandName>, they will pay top <Dink> for it!
That’s a fancy <Journal> you’ve got there.
<yes><NPCName> actually told me all about it.
<no>I can’t imagine how much it means to her.
<haha>She must really trust you, <PlayerName>!
My brother says he’s been spending a lot of time looking for new items to ship over to us here on <IslandName>.
<thinking>He assures me he’s been working a lot.
<yes>I hope he’s okay.
<shy>Thanks for doing so much business with me, <PlayerName>.
<haha>And remember, they ain’t good unless their John’s Goods!
I got a scale in my shop for weighing up any big items you can bring me.
<yes>Huge eggs and the like.
I’ll give you a great price for them, so it’s worth hauling them in if you can!
<thinking>You don’t talk too much, but your wallet does.
<yes>I really like that about you, <PlayerName>.
<yes>It’s nice to see you today, <PlayerName>.
<no>We don’t have to do a transaction today.
<yes>Having this discussion is nearly as nice as making some <Dinks>.
You know what <PlayerName>?
<yes>I wish my brother was more like you.
<yes>You work hard, you’re polite and you’re very kind.
<haha>He’s kind of ratbag sometimes!
<no>I’m sorry that the tools I sell break pretty often.
<thinking>I’ve asked my brother back in <SouthCity> to try and get higher quality products.
<shy>I guess he is just trying to make every <Dink> count...
<sigh>I wish I didn’t have to run my shop for so many hours a day.
<haha>But you know what they say, “If you aren’t open then you aren’t making <Dinks>”
<sigh>I could really use some time off though...
<sigh>Somebody asked me for a “Refund” the other day.
Can you believe that? They wanted ALL their dinks back!
I gave them half. Fair’s fair, I reckon.
<thinking> Hey, do you want half a shovel?
No thanks
Sure!
Suit yourself
<thinking>Hmmm… I think I’ll hold onto it for now.
<no>I didn’t expect it to be in such high demand!
<no> Sometimes it can get quite lonely in my shop, working such long hours.
Luckily, I have hundreds and hundreds of items to keep me company.
<haha> Oh, and you, too!
Thanks for making time for me, <PlayerName>.
<no> Even if it’s an absolute bargain, it can be sad to part with your hard-earned <Dinks>.
But boy, the rush you get from a massive sale? There’s just nothing like it!
<haha>See, buying low and selling high isn’t just good trading advice, it’s also how I feel.
I might complain about working a fair bit, but truth is, I’m not sure what to do on my day off.
Time spent not trying to make <Dinks> can feel wasted, don’t you think?
I get it.
Not really...
I don't like to work to much.
<haha>You might just be a born trader after all!
<haha>I might believe you if you weren't here so much!
<haha>Says the person buying up all my tools!
<IslandName> is really starting to feel like a home.
<haha>I reckon it is home now!
I love waking up and having a wander around my shop every morning.
And seeing you is always a treat too, <PlayerName>!
Sorry I’ve been running a bit late for work lately, <PlayerName>.
<shy>I know sometimes you're in there waiting for me…
<haha>I guess I just want to say thanks for waiting!
<glee>It’s always good talking to you <PlayerName>.
<haha>It almost makes me forget that I work 12 hour days, 6 days a week.
You know, I would love to give you more great deals, <PlayerName>.
Mates rates, you know?
<glee>Because we’re good mates, right?
<sigh>Unfortunately, my brother says he really needs a big payment this month...
You’re a totally different person from when we met, <PlayerName>.
<haha>I mean, you’ve always been good at what you do, don’t get me wrong.
<yes>But I really feel like you’ve grown a lot since you helped me get set up here on <IslandName>.
<IslandName> feels like my home now.
<thinking>Sure, I sometimes miss <SouthCity>.
<haha>Although, if I ever went back, I would miss everyone here on <IslandName> a lot!
<yes>When my brother decided to move my business here we were taking a pretty big risk.
<yes>But I'm very glad he made that decision for me!
<glee>He doesn't know what he's missing here on <IslandName>!
Now that we’re friends, I feel like I can tell you a few trade secrets.
Listen, trading isn't JUST about getting a good deal you know.
<thinking>Oh, wait, I guess it is.
<yes>Yeah. Go for good deals.
<haha>Honestly, that's all there is to it.
<yes>In life, you’ve always got to decide what to hold on to and what to let go.
<thinking>There’s always a tradeoff…
<no>It wasn’t easy, moving here.
But taking a risk like this? And seeing everything work out like it has?
<proud>I got a feeling like it’s all gonna be worth it.
<yes>Just gotta keep working. \n One day at a time.
Thanks for listening, <PlayerName>.
<yes>You know, I grew this beard when I was a bit younger.
My brother asked if he could trade me something for my moustache.
I figured it would grow back, you know?
<sigh>It never did…
<no>You know, it doesn’t bother me too much working hard to help my brother.
<yes>He's a good guys, he just gets himself into trouble.
<no>Always saying things like “Lets make some deals, let’s trade some wheels”
<shy>My brother says he’s too busy to come and visit me here on <IslandName>.
<no>He’s got a boat, but he says he can’t even take it out for a quick visit.
<sigh>It’s a real shame...
<yes>I think he'd like you, <PlayerName>.
<yes>It’s tough to do inventory with all this stormy racket…
What are you up to, <PlayerName>?
Try and stay safe and dry, <PlayerName>!
<no>I hate all this thunder and lightning!
<yes>But it's always good to see you, <PlayerName>.
Don't catch a cold, <PlayerName>!
It’s raining, it’s storming and who do I see but <PlayerName>!
Stay safe, <PlayerName>!
It’s clear you’ve been working hard to get <IslandName> together, <PlayerName>
It’s starting to shape up around here!
<IslandName> has really changed since you help get me set up here!
<yes>It’s starting to feel like home, you know what I mean?
I can’t believe how good <IslandName> is looking!
It’s amazing how much I miss while I’m at work in my shop!
Did you do all this <PlayerName>?
<IslandName> has never looked better!
<haha>People aren’t going to want to visit my shop if you keep it looking this good, <PlayerName>!
My dad used to say “Windy weather is the best time to set sale!”
<no>No idea what he meant.
<sigh>Oh, okay then.
See you <PlayerName>.
Ah, <PlayerName>!
Are you out here enjoying that breeze too?
<haha>Easy breezy!
Lovely breeze today!
I’m just glad I’m outside for it!
Bye bye, <PlayerName>!
Righto.
I got my <Kite>, <PlayerName>.
<haha>Stay out of my way, because I’ll be zooming around with this bad boy all arvo!
<haha>I'll be hitting plenty of <PaperLanterns> with it, just you see!
G’day <PlayerName>.
Today is <SkyFest>!
<haha>I reckon the sky can’t get prettier than last year!
Wow!
<glee>You don’t see something like this <Aurora> every day!
Really makes you think how lucky we all are to live here on <IslandName>.
<yes>Glad you’re here to share the day with me, <PlayerName>.
Did you finish up your <Kite>, <PlayerName>?
A <SkyFest> <Kite> is a very important thing, so take your time!
Ah ha! So you must be <PlayerName>!
Hey <PlayerName>, do you know why I became a travelling trader?
I mean, I bloody love trading, I really do, but I had always imagined trading in my own shop in <SouthCity>.
But my brother makes ..small mistakes, sometimes.
<no>Actually, he makes big mistakes all the time.
<haha>But even though we’re not related by blood, I bloody love him!
You see, my brother and I were both adopted.
Growing up we were always trading things between each other.
But when my brother got into a bit of trouble in <SouthCity> we needed to make <Dinks> and quickly!
We came up with a surefire plan.
One of us would become a <Nomad>. Travel around to the islands outside of <SouthCity> trading items back and forth to the other.
Good plan, right?
<haha>I thought so too!
But my brother can be sneaky, <PlayerName>.
I don’t know how it happened, but suddenly I was the one who was leaving <SouthCity>!
Meanwhile, <NPCName> is the one back in <SouthCity> with his own store.
<no>And he’s selling the things I send him, no less!
<shy>I don’t know how, but he always manages to convince me his plan is the best one...
My brother still has my old steam boat back home.
<thinking>I hope he’s treating the old girl well.
<glee>She’s my pride and joy. I can’t wait to see her again some day.
<haha>I mean, the only thing you can catch in <SouthCity> are <Blobfish>!
<sigh> Somebody asked me for a “Refund” the other day.
